column1: round the stumps comes Malinga, angling the ball in sharply to threaten de Kock's off stump. The bat comes down in time, and he finds a single to gully
Reeza's slightly squared up as he presses forward to defend a full one that swings away from him
well, so much for pace and bounce. Malinga hits a length outside off, and the ball scoots through low as Hendricks pushes to cover
Malinga pulls his length back just a touch, and Hendricks is back and across to defend
Malinga finds some nice shape away from the right-hander, Hendricks hopping across and leaving it well alone
beaten outside off, pushing forward at an away-swinger
Vishwa lands his first ball full outside off, de Kock coming forward to drive to cover
past a diving Perera! De Kocks is forward again, angling his square drive to beat point. He also times it well enough to beat a diving Perera, sprinting across from third man

cracked square! De Kock steps forward into another square drive, hitting this one with a little more vim to thread the gap to the left of point. And with the shot, a slip goes out to add protection to the off side
but it makes no difference! Vishwa keeps pitching the ball right up to de Kock, looking for swing, but he's also offering width, and this is driven firmly through extra cover
a little straighter, and slightly quicker at 139km/h, and de Kock drives to mid off

slammed through cover! De Kock is peppering the off side boundary. Having hit one fine, and one square, de Kock now steps into a flowing cover drive that sends the ball bouncing out to the wide long off boundary
nice line from Malinga, finding the outside half of Hendricks' bat with a full outswinger on off stump
sharp yorker! Malinga comes around the stumps to de Kock, sending down a slippery yorker that is honing in on off stump before de Kock digs it out
slanting in towards off stump, but off a length this time, and de Kock presses forward in defence
slung down, round-arm from around the stumps, and de Kock jams this one out to cover
just a little too straight from Malinga, and he's worked out to that man at deep backward square
defended into the off side to end the over
de Silva comes around the stumps, spearing the ball in at middle to test de Kock's defence
floated down on off stump, de Kock is forward to defend
de Kock strides into a drive, but pings the cover field
chipped, inside-out over cover by de Kock, who jumped down the track and wasn't quite to the pitch, but nevertheless went through with the lofted drive
a little less flight on this one at 97km/h, and it's defended back to the bowler
just over a diving mid on! De Kock comes down the track again and looks to attack the leg side. He doesn't really get under his smear to leg, but Rajitha can't leap high enough at mid on to get to it
nice shape from Malinga, the ball starting on middle and leg and swinging to off as Hendricks defends
flicked down to fine leg, and that will settle him a little. Malinga strays down leg, and Hendricks just needs to get bat on his glance
Malinga adjusts his line, aiming closer to off stump, and Hendricks is forward to defend
too straight again, and he's worked off the pads for a brace
yorker! And it's a beaut. Malinga slings down a slow yorker that dips on Hendricks at the very last moment. He does well to keep it out
punched firmly off the back foot, textbook stuff from Hendricks, who is usually very strong punching through cover. Silken touch
the runs keep flowing! Vishwa sends down a low full toss, and de Kock punts it back down the ground for his fifth boundary in the last six balls he's faced from the left-armer
this one slips out, too wide and it's called as such
de Kock is forward to drive again, but his shot finds cover
Vishwa aims very full, at off stump, and de Kock digs it out back to him
big swish outside off from de Kock, but it's a play-and-a-miss
another big drive from de Kock, but again he can't put bat to ball outside off
solid defence to end the over as Vishwa aims for the top of off
Rajitha hits a length in the channel, Hendricks staying deep to defend
slotted through cover! Too full from Rajitha, and Hendricks comes forward to lace a handsome drive through cover with his left elbow leading the shot
Rajitha pulls his length back in response, and he's worked off the hip for a single
nicely bowled, tight on off stump and on a good length, and de Kock can only defend
beaten on the inside edge! Fizzing delivery from Rajitha, who hits a length and gets it to seam back in through the gate and just past the stumps
but he can't follow it up, aiming this one too straight to allow de Kock to clip him firmly to the midwicket boundary, raising the fifty in the process
angled across Hendricks, who leans forward and lets it go past
Hendricks whips across his front pad to collect a single down to fine leg
flicked to midwicket, de Kock maintaining excellent balance as he leans over a delivery angled into his pads
just short of extra cover! Sri Lanka have a close catcher at extra cover, and de Kock almost drives it straight to him as this one just seems to stop a little off the pitch
chopped down to gully
full and wide, and de Kock slashes down to third man
de Kock presents the full face to push to mid on
on the walk, on the up! Beautifully driven by de Kock, who threads the gap between cover and mid off perfectly
Rajitha aims this one closer to off stump, de Kock punching it back to him
Rajitha tries a slower ball, but it slips out of the side of his hand and floats much too far outside off
back to full pace, and de Kock drives firmly to mid off
another slower one, but de Kock picks it early and thumps it straight back down the ground for his 11th boundary
too straight, and de Kock flicks down to fine leg for his 20th ODI fifty, and sixth against Sri Lanka. He looks in ominous touch
offbreak, and it's milked into the leg side for a single that puts de Kock back on strike
floated up on off stump, de Kock lunging forward to defend
this one slips down the leg side, but de Kock's sweep goes straight to short fine leg
this wasn't all that short, but de Kock hops onto the back foot and pulls down to long on
quicker, and holding its line outside off, Hendricks reading it and forcing to point
flicked off the toes for a single to midwicket
Rajitha hits the seam, and Hendricks' defensive poke is inside edged onto his thigh
this one is fuller, and Hendricks is watchfully forward to meet it
beaten outside off, Hendricks stepping into a drive but missing the ball
Hendricks is forward to drive to cover, finding space for a quick single
rising off a length and straight, de Kock hopping to defend
de Kock is forward to drive, picking out mid off with the shot
spinning in to Hendricks, who tucks to the leg side from deep inside the crease
flighted up extra high outside off, the ball dipping and almost yorking Hendricks' drive
milked behind square on the leg side for a single
de Kock backs away, slapping a cut in front of point
nicely read by Hendricks, who waits on the back foot for the ball to break away from him and then punches firmly and straight through the gap at cover point
punched down to long on for an ambled single
Hendricks gets up on his toes and punches off the back foot, but the shot goes nowhere
beaten, on the drive! Hendricks is only half forward for an airy waft
this one might have kept just a little low, but Hendricks adjusts well enough and defends to cover
Hendricks is forward again, and he can't quite time his drive to mid off
Rajitha aims full, Hendricks threading a gap at cover to keep the strike
Akila flights an offbreak outside off, Hendricks coming forward to smother it
Hendricks goes back and across, nurdling a single through square leg
pushed through mid on for a single
Hendricks finds midwicket, talling into the leg side
he gets his wrists to do a little more work on this one, placing the shot to the left of midwicket to find a single
tip-and-run single for de Kock, who pushes to cover and sets off straight away
firmly pushed through extra cover, and they take on the fielder in the deep for a second
short of a driveable length outside off, de Kock slapping through cover for one

finally the breakthrough comes! A surprise bouncer from Malinga does the trick. Hendricks swivels as he tries to pull it, but he can't control the shot or keep it down and Akila holds a simple catch at fine leg
Malinga digs another one in, but it slips down the leg side and is called wide
sharp bouncer! Du Plessis is taken surprise, and inside edges a rushed pull into his own chest, letting out a grunt as the ball hits him
and again! Short and rising outside off, and zipping past du Plessis as he pulls out of a hook shot. The square leg umpire signals two for the over
just short of a good length, outside off, and du Plessis pushes it to cover
de Kock comes forward to place a soft drive through cover, collecting a single
legbreak, tossed up on middle and leg to draw du Plessis forward in defence
and an offbreak to follow it up, du Plessis again coming forward to smother it back down the track
spinning in to du Plessis, who stays deep to work a single with the turn into the leg side
floated up very high, and in fact it's a full toss that de Kock comes forward to, punting him out to deep midwicket for a couple
forced through point for a single out to the sweeper
full and dipping outside off, driven straight to extra cover
short ball at leg stump, ducks under it
into the long leg fence. Strange length with no one back there. It's at his hips and he whips it to the boundary
offcutter at a length on middle stump, flicks to midwicket
slower on middle stump, looks to defend and gets it off the inside half of the bat
beaten. Short ball outside off, looks to pull and is beaten on the top edge
drills it to the extra cover fence. Nice flow through that shot. This is lobbed up full and wide outside off, gets to the pitch and takes the runs
and again. This time it's short and wide and asking to be hit. QDK gets on the back foot and spanks it in front of the same fielder
length on off stump, poked to long-off on the front foot
length outside off, shuffles and ramps it fine
legbreak at a length on off stump, turns away sharply from the edge as he looks to drive
length on middle stump, tapped back to the bowler off the back foot
length just outside off, blocked on the front foot
length just outside off, jabbed to extra cover on the front foot
short of a length on leg stump, short-arm pull straight to short fine
short of a length on leg stump, nudged to deep square off the back foot
length on middle stump, flicked uppishly to long-on's right
length on off stump, opens the face and runs it to point
short and wide outside off, allows it to skid away and slaps it behind square with an open face
short ball at middle stump, jumps into the crease, gets the front leg out of the way and puts a ton of core strength into this pull to send it flying over midwicket
length on off stump, tapped to cover on the front foot
short of a length and skidding in at middle stump, clears the front leg again and keeps the pull along the floor to find the midwicket boundary. Into the 90s
length on leg stump, flicked to midwicket
length on off stump, tapped to sweeper cover
length just outside off, dead-batted towards the keeper
length outside off, hurriedly tapped into the covers on the rise

taken by Dickwella! QDK gets a leading edge looking to whip a horrible delivery down leg side. Wants to get it over short fine but closes the face too early. Goes high and right on top of Dickwella. Simple take. Was shaping to be a memorable hundred, cut short tamely
length on off stump, pushed to extra cover on the front foot
short of a length on off stump, punched to extra cover off the back foot
length outside off, guided to third man
length on off stump, opens the face and drops this into the off side
length outside off, nice flowing drive on the up, straight to extra cover
short and down leg side, watchful pull out to deep square
full and just outside off, driven straight to mid-off
length on off stump, allows it to come on, opens the face and runs it to third man's right
bouncer down leg side, left alone
length outside off, driven to extra cover on the rise
short outside off, cut to sweeper cover

sensational diving catch from Rajitha! Bouncer outside off. Looks to hook but he's on the front foot. It's rising as he plays and he gets a top edge that is dipping rapidly as Rajitha runs in deep square. Keeps his eyes on it, gets low and lunges forward to hold on. Superb
length outside off, punched to extra cover on the up
length outside off, tapped to extra cover with an angled bat
gets it wide of mid-off. Length outside off, leans in on the front foot and caresses this on the rise. That didn't quite come on, he had to get the timing spot on
short and wide outside off, cut to sweeper cover
shot. Short ball just outside off, allows that to rise and pulls firmly to deep square's left
oh well controlled. Short ball rising in the corridor. He's on the front foot but he gets the bat above the ball and rolls his wrists to beat fine leg to the left
shot! Short outside off, allows it to come on and stays leg side of it before opening the face late and getting this punch past point
more class! Length outside off, in the corridor. Gets on top of the line and opens the face again on the back foot punch. Gets it to point's left
through the first slip region where there was a slip a couple of balls ago. Short of a length in the corridor. Looks to punch with a straight bat, is slightly inside the line and gets an edge
length outside off, blocked on the front foot
length on leg stump, uses the pace and nudges this to deep square's right and beats short fine's slide and dive at the rope as well. He'll need some physio attention after landing awkwardly
short of a length just outside off, beaten on the edge as he looks to run it down
length on middle, clipped to deep square with soft hands
length outside off, left alone
length outside off, beaten on the outside edge
length just outside off, punched to mid-off on the rise
length on off stump, flicked to midwicket
short of a length and in at off stump, chopped to extra cover
length on middle stump, clipped to midwicket's right
length on leg stump, a legbreak, turned into the leg side with soft hands
full on middle stump, flicked to midwicket
length outside off, shuffles and flicks
short of a length outside off, punched to extra cover on the rise
length and wide outside off, reaches out and slashes this over point on the rise
shot. Overpitched outside off, in the zone, and pummeled wide of extra cover. Sri Lanka have let the momentum go completely
full on leg stump, flicked to deep square
slower ball on a length outside off, blocked on the front foot
loses leg stump! Overpitched slower ball on leg stump and Mulder has walked across and played all around it with the flick. The soft dismissals are racking up here
length on leg stump, nudged through midwicket's right
length on off stump, watchfully defended into the off side
length on off stump, sliced to point
full on middle stump, flicked to deep square
full on off stump, driven straight to mid-off
full on off stump, flicked to midwicket
length at off stump, defended on the back foot
full on leg stump, flicked to deep square
length outside off, opens the face and runs it down to third man
slower ball at a length down leg side, reaches out and tickles it fine
low full toss on leg stump, flicked to deep square
length on leg stump, flicked to deep square
length on off stump, blocked on the front foot
full on off stump, driven with the turn to long-off
legbreak from a length on middle stump. Closes the face and defends into the leg side
legbreak, full on off stump, driven back to the bowler on the bounce
overpitched on off stump, driven to mid-off's left
full on off stump, driven to long-off
length on off stump, defended down the pitch
length outside off, sliced on the up to sweeper cover
slower ball, short and wide outside off. Cut to sweeper
slower ball on a length at leg stump, flicked to deep square
short ball at leg stump, controlled hook down to fine leg
short and wide outside off, left alone
short ball at off stump, gets on top of the bounce to defend
flicked through square leg, and du Plessis now has 5,000 runs in ODIs
down the track comes du Plessis, chipping down the ground and calling immediately for two. But Miller slips turning for the second, so it's just a single
worked into the leg side, but straight to the fielder
slower ball from Malinga, and du Plessis watches it all the way out of the hand and onto the bat, defending it at his feet
du Plessis chops a forcing stroke into the covers, and again he finds the field
worked off the straight, and out through square leg for a single
full, and punched firmly back to the bowler
Miller rises with a short one outside off, angling it down to third man to raise the 200
du Plessis is forward to drive out to the cover sweeper
du Plessis comes forward, driving back to the bowler
he's down the track this time, but can't beat a diving mid on
milked into the leg side, du Plessis working with the spin
Miller skips down to meet the ball on the full, adding a single to long on
whipped with plenty of bottom hand! Du Plessis used his feet well too, getting down at the ball with a quick shimmy and muscling it into the leg side
and a quick single keeps the strike
beaten outside off by one that holds its line
fifty up for du Plessis, and it comes with a push to point and a quick single. He's been in amazing form recently - seven consecutive matches where he's scored fifty or more across formats
pushed back at the bowler
Miller hits a full one hard into the turf, the ball bouncing up and over Perera's head
just short of the long off boundary! Du Plessis gives the bowler the charge and swings his hands cleanly through the line
worked against the spin into the leg side for a single
flicked through midwicket for a single
Miller keeps his bat straight and his left elbow high to find a single to long on
du Plessis jumps out at the spinner, who sees him coming and pulls his length back to keep him to a little push to leg
placed through cover for one
and yet another single to end the over, du Plessis pinging long on with a drive
du Plessis hops over a rising, short ball and looks for a single to gully, but there's none to be had
this keeps low! The ball landed a little short and du Plessis went back to pull, but it just scuttled through and pegged the off stump back
angled across Andile, who dabs it down to slip, on the bounce
bouncer from Perera, and Andile sways out of the way as it bursts past him
and he's off the mark with a front-foot guide down to third man
flicked off the pads to deep square, and he'll keep the strike
tapped back to the bowler
forced through cover to turn the strike over
floated down very full on off stump, and he drives to long off
whipped off the toes for a single to midwicket

sliced to point! Phehlukwayo backed away a little, slashing hard at a full, wide one. I'm not sure if he's looking to cut or to drive, but he ends up spooning a high catch to a back-peddling Fernando at point. A bit of a nothing shot, really
Rabada's off the mark straight away with a neat little drive to long off
Rabada is forward to push defensively back to the bowler
Perera comes round the wicket this time, angling a length delivery in to the stumps to get Rabada defending
angled down to third man, and now he finds the single
whoops, this one slips down the leg side and Miller can't reach it with his flick
Miller dead-bats to cover, but there's no single to be had
Miller walks across and glances a straight delivery, but finds short fine leg with the shot
and now he finds a single to keep the strike, clipping a full ball through square leg
Miller's down the track to slug a strong shot back over de Silva's head. The long on fielder gets to it with a slide, but the ball spins past his attempted stop and it's a boundary
swiped into the leg side for a single
Rabada finds a gap at cover, and turns the strike back over

Miller runs past one! He was down the track again, but not to the pitch, and the ball from de Silva gripped and spun past him as he groped at it. Dickwella has the bails off in a flash, and South Africa slip further from what was a great position
Nortje lunges forward at the first ball he faces in international cricket, smothering the spin
and his second almost goes for four! Well played, just waiting on it to turn deep in the crease and dabbing down to the third man boundary
length on leg stump, gets on the back foot and stabs to fine leg off the back foot

got him! Big edge from Rabada, sails to Dickwella's left and he gets low and lunges to take it. It's a length ball slanted across him and he pays for playing away from the body. Things ending rapidly for South Africa
length and in at middle stump, defended from deep in the crease
lbw appeal turned down as he gets an inside edge on this. Length ball just outside off, looks to stab to third man and can't get it away coz of the angle in
full on off stump, driven to mid-off
length ball wide outside off, slashes and misses
length on off stump, blocked on the front foot
length on middle stump, shuffles and nudges to square leg
length on off stump, driven to long-off
length on off stump, pushed down the pitch off the front foot
full on off stump, driven down to long-on
length at off stump, defended on the front foot
slower yorker at middle stump, jammed into the leg side
attempted yorker slides down leg side

big appeal for catch behind but the umpire says no. Length ball dipping in late from outside off. Beaten on the inside edge. Might have just brushed the back flap as it went past. It was outside the line
short and wide outside off, cut to third man
oh dear. A misfield at mid-off. Full slower ball at off stump, deceived by it completely. Just hangs the bat out and manages to tap to mid-off who makes a mess of it
length at off stump, blocked on the front foot
length outside off, mistimed drive to extra cover off the toe-end
length outside off, defended into the off side
length at off stump, defended off the back foot
short of a length outside off, stabbed into the off side off the back foot
Sri Lanka review an lbw. Looks good. Nortje was looking to reverse and was struck in front of middle stump. But was it boot or glove? The ball was really full...and it hit glove. Good decsion.
length outside off, blocked on the front foot
legbreak on off stump, overpitched. Driven back to the bowler
just clears mid-on. Slower ball on a length and he's deceived on the slog. Ends up dragging it wide of that feilder with feet rooted to the crease
that's plumb. Vintage Malinga. A vicious, dipping yorker at middle stump, jamming his back toe into the crease as he looks to keep it out
low full toss on middle stump, punched to mid-off and a mad rush to the other end. Direct hit would have got him, but Akila misses
slower ball at a length on off stump, thick edge to third man off the front foot
full slower ball on off stump, dug into the off side off the front foot
full outside off, tapped to extra cover off the front foot

stumping appeal sent upstairs. This could be close...it looks out in fact. Overpitched legbreak outside off, looks to go against the turn and slog this. It looks like the curve of his boot has kept him ON the line rather than behind it. Yes. He's out
short of length in the rib cage, tucked away towards fine leg for a couple

direct hit! Should be okay though. Short of length on middle and leg, dabs it in front of square and sets off, the fielder swoops low and underarms it on to the stumps, but Avishka was home, just put his bat down in time
short of length on middle and leg and pulled away over midwicket for the first four of the innings
back of length around middle, stays back and defends it on the leg side
short of length outside off at 148kph, looks to swat it away but misses as the ball swings away
down the leg side, goes for the flick but it's too far away, once again was bowled at 148kph
144 kph, length on middle and leg, looks to flick but misses and is wrapped on the thigh
short of length around off, defended from the back foot
short of length outside off, stands tall and punches it towards point off the back foot, straight to the fielder thuogh
length on middle and leg, flicked away towards deep square leg, fine leg comes across to cut it off
length around off, 135kph, but doesn't rise much, Dickwella looks to pull but it sneaks under, on the bounce to de Kock
fuller on the leg stump, Dickwella is on the back foot, plays it towards mid-on with a straight bat, a quick single
a touch fuller outside off, stays in the crease and taps it towards covers
short of length around off, stays back and dabs it towards cover-point
short of length on the stumps, gets Dickwella jumping and beats the bat to hit the batsman high on the pads, picthed outside leg though

that's the 100th ODI wicket for Rabada! Short of length this time aimed at the body, Dickwella gives himself some room and looks to pull it away, gets a top edge that skies towards the keeper, de Kock pedals back and takes it near his chest before falling backwards
hits it towards mid-on from the bottom of the bat
another short one, another attempted pull and another top edge but luckily for Fernando and Sri Lanka, this one sails over the keeper's head, in fact all the way for a six
short again, too high and down the leg side as well, 149kph, the batsman was looking to get some bat on it, cannot
looking for the yorker but end up bowling a full toss, pushed towards mid-on
short of length on middle and leg, tucked away towards square leg
back of length on the stumps, gets behind the line and defends it down the wicket
fuller around off, smashed but straight towards extra cover
back of length around off, stays back and dabs it towards point
an appeal for lbw but that was pitching outside leg. Gets the batsman jumping and beats the flick to wrap him on the knee roll. Looked a bit high too
length ball on the pads, tucked away towards square leg
back of length around off, stays back and defends it towards extra cover
dropped by Ngidi at third man! Fuller around off, Perera smashes at it, gets an outside edge that flies towards third man, Ngidi comes forward and gets down but it goes through his hands
short of length at the body, Perera manages to duck under just in time
fuller but angling on the pads, goes for the flick, misses but will get four leg-byes
length around off, stays back and taps it towards covers
short of length on the stumps, gets behind the line of the ball and defends
bowled'im! Crashed into the off stump! Length outside off, nips back, Fernando went for another pull but misses it altogether this time. Sri Lanka have lost both their openers now
back of length around off, defended towards point from the back foot
length outside off, looks to hit it through covers but misses
back of length outside off, dabs it towards third man for one
length on the stumps, tapped towards mid-on for a quick single
back of length just outside off, stays on the back foot and defends
fuller outside off, looks to smash but not quite from the middle of the bat, a single to the mid-off's right
149kph! Length outside off, pushes at it and gets beaten, de Kock collect it near his head
back of length around off, defends it towards covers
short of length around off, goes for the pull, not much power behind it but the outfield is quick there, a bit of tag team work near the deep midwicket boundary
back of length around off, defends it towards covers off the back foot
short of length down the leg side, 151kph, goes for the pull but misses
a short one aimed at the batsman's neck who was looking to duck under, the ball hits the ball and goes towards third man
short of length around off, punched towards the bowler from the back foot
length outside off, drives it on the up towards backward point, a misfield there allows a run
short of length on the stumps, defended back towards the bowler
a touch fuller this time, Perera stays back and punches it towards the bowler
fuller on the stumps, comes half forward and drives it towards mid-on
length around middle and leg, defends it towards covers from the back foot
147kph, fuller outside off, comes forward to drive but the ball sneaks under the bat
back of length outside off, pushed towards point off the back foot

fuller on the pads and clipped away towards fine leg, races away towards the boundary but Ngidi sprints to his right, stops the ball with his right hand and pushes it inside before the momentum takes him over
smashed over short midwicket, was a touch fuller around off, Oshada is deep in his crease, goes across and hits it over the fielder
short of length outside off, stays back and opens the face of the bat to run it down towards third man
a short one on the leg stump, aimed at the batsman, Perera ducks under quite comfortably though
140kph, length around off, stays behind and blocks
length ball around off and coming back in, bowled wide of the crease. Beats the flick to hit the pads, was sliding down though
short of length outside off, goes back and opens the face to run it past first slip, Rabada at third man puts in the slide but cannot prevent the boundary
back of length around off, defended from the crease
short of length outside off, guides it past first slip once more, Rabada cuts it down this time
fuller outside off, looks to go over extra cover, gets a thick outside edge towards third man

strikes first ball! And the Durban hero falls! Kusal Perera, the man who defied South Africa in the most epic manner not too long ago, is taken out by a ball measured at 145 kph on the speedgun. And yet it seems as if his undoing is because he is too early into the shot. The ball - back of a length on leg stump - seems to stick in the pitch and the left-hander, looking to flick it over midwicket, only ends up top-edging towards point where Miller runs in, dives forward and takes a splendid catch
143 kph, makes him hop with a shortish delivery outside off and Mendis, carefully as he could, dabs it to point

148kph, pitches it up and his pace - and South Africa's ploy of bowling short with the new ball - has Mendis stuck in the crease. He tries to work the ball into the leg side, but ends up spooning a leading edge to point
good length ball on off stump, Mendis waits on it a little better, meets it under his eyes and guides it to third man
126kph, gets behind a fuller delivery on leg stump and turns it to midwicket
bangs it in short and outside off at 142 kph, Fernando looks to upper cut it, but he doesn't connect
extra bounce off a good length as Mendis yanks his bottom hand off after knocking the ball, on middle stump, to midwicket
back of a length on off stump, safely defends
lines up the short of a length delivery outside off very nicely and then taps it on top of the bounce to third man
opens the face and guides the good length ball outside off to third man. Oshada has looked the part this innings. Sensible shots. Good composure. Gorgeous technique.
nudges the shortish delivery off the pads through midwicket
turns the face and guides the ball to point
lifts it over mid-off. Splendid shot-making! It's pitched up. It's the kind other batsman would only defend. But Mendis extends his hands, using a straight bat, and beating Andile Phehlukwayo
extra pace here - the ball banged into the deck and rising above the cutting blade of Kusal Mendis
superb bowling. At 142 kph, even the slightest bit of movement can be dangerous. So Nortje pitches it on middle stump and squares Mendis up as he blocks
gets behind the short of a length ball outside off and punches it, quite firmly, to cover point

chops it down on the practice pitches and it leaps over the point fielder and rushes away to deep third man. It looks a tight second run with Tahir doing wonderfully well but de Kock couldn't collect at the strikers end

that is all class! The straight drive out of the Sachin Tendulkar highlight reel! From the confident front-foot stride, the high elbow, all the way to treating a perfectly good length ball with regal disdain.
nudges a length ball on middle and leg through midwicket
hangs back, waiting until the last second to turn the bat face and beat the point fielder. Excellent batting, made possible by him being switched on enough to judge the length of the short ball early
turns the back of a length delivery out to deep square leg
bouncer but it's too high. Booo! It looks far too awesome to be punished like that. Hitting the deck. Rising above the batsman's shoulder as he sways out of its way outside off
tries another bouncer, but this time he's waiting, rocking back and hooking the ball to the long leg boundary. Handy top edge but hey, he's racing
nudges the fuller delivery on middle to deep square leg
slower ball on off stump but Mendis reads it so well and defends it with no fuss
lets the short ball outside off come to him, showing no fear that it's 143 kph, and calmly runs it down to deep third man
whips a 144 kph length ball on leg stump to deep square leg. Looks a bit hurried on this occasion
141 kph, short, mean and angled at the body, but again, Oshada is boss-like, getting up on his tippy-toes and defending it whilst barely batting an eyelid
opens the face as he steers the back of a length delivery behind point
flicks the ball straying on leg stump away to deep midwicket
pitched up on middle stump at 141 kph, but Oshada defends it stout-heartedly
starts with a full toss - though largely that's because Mendis is so far forward, looming over the ball outside off and flicking it smartly straight of midwicket

bowls it quicker and flatter, but the length is still full. That's what brings Oshada forward, with a closed face of the bat. Somehow he's able ot play against the turn and find a single to deep square leg
lunges forward outside off, conscious to reach the pitch of the legbreak, and drives with the turn to long-off
another shot against the turn, but Oshada isn't able to beat square leg. Tahir is really getting the ball to dip here
tosses it up outside off, Oshada defends for once

that's the flipper and he bowls it dead straight. Plus it keeps low too. Oshada is right in front of all three sticks but then his bat comes down to save the day. Ooooh, this is fun, but we need to break for drinks
hits the deck on off stump at 144 kph, but the sound off that bat as Mendis meets it with his defence is far more striking
142kph, gets inside the line of a shortish delivery on middle and leg and clips it to deep square leg
loads up the pull shot as Nortje goes short again. Hits it in front of square but there's protection in the deep
full on middle, Mendis gets forward and defends with poise

bouncer has him hopping. This is at 147 and it is climbing straight up to his head, even as he gets up off his toes. Mendis is committed to fending it away and if there'd been a short leg, he might have been gone
back of a length on off stump, defends
fuller delivery outside off, he gets forward to defend
width on offer and he leans forward and flays it through the covers. Mendis wants two but Oshada isn't so certain and so they decide to be safe and not sorry
goes back, and by virtue of that, spots the googly. The good length ball spins into him and Mendis is able to flick it to square leg
another googly, which Oshada turns to midwicket
tosses it up outside off - possibly another wrong 'un - and Oshada hits with the turn to midwicket
full and outside off, Mendis is to the pitch of it and taps it to long-on
stays back to the shortish delivery and taps it to point
eases it to point
shortish on off stump, Mendis blunts it well
waits on the short ball on off stump and tucks it away to long leg
slips down leg as Oshada tries to flick it
looks for the yorker, but Oshada is wise to his tricks, turns the straight ball to midwicket
bouncer outside off, but he's able to drag it, and keep it down, to find a single at long leg
lays into the sweep, taking a length ball outside off and hammering it to the left of short fine leg, but Phehlukwayo puts in the dive and saves the boundary
whips the fuller delivery on middle to midwicket

confusion, run-out chance, direct hit! Great work from Nortje at short third man! Mendis is the man running to the danger end but Oshada is never convinced. Worse. He's taken a couple of steps down the track and then just stops. That means Mends has run halfway down the pitch. Then he stops. Seeing Mendis has run halfway down the pitch Oshada accepts the single but by that time the damage is done. Nortje picks the ball up, throws the stumps at the strikers end down and Sri Lanka lose a big one. Mendis actually threw his bat away in pure frustration at that horrible turn of events (Oh and before I forget, the ball was shortish and outside off, Oshada played a deft little dab)
back of a length and outside off, steers it to point
full on off stump but de Silva is happy to stay deep in his crease and block

doesn't pick the googly. It's a tossed up ball outside off, de Silva lunges forward to block, but he's way outside the line of the ball as it turns the wrong way. Inside edge would have been caught at short leg

a huge appeal for lbw and given by Shaun George! Oshada sends it upstairs immediately though. Length ball on the stumps and angling on to the pads, Oshada misses the flick and is hit on the pads. The front foot is fine. The ball pitched outside off, the impact is in front of middle and leg but it would have gone on to just clip the top of the leg stump. The umpire's call it is and that was out. Sri Lanka are five down now
welcomed with a short one angling across, Thisara sways away and lets it go
a touch fuller on middle and leg, Thisara makes some room and drives it towards mid-off
short of length outside off, goes back and looks to upper-cut it, misses
back of length at the batsman, who once again moves away and steers it to the right of the backward point
length around off, 144kph, stays a bit low as well, defended from the back foot
fuller around off, comes forward and pushes at it, a thick outside edge goes towards short third man
flighted around off, Dhananjaya stays in the crease and dabs it towards cover-point
flatter and quicker on the stumps, defended again
fuller around off, pushed towards mid-on
length around off, left alone by the batsman
too full outside off, Thisara jams his bat at it and digs it out towards cover
length around off, stays behind the line and defends
a back-of-the-hand slower one gone wrong, length ball down the leg side, helped along to the fine leg boundary
a bouncer this time, Dhananjaya ducks under easily
length ball on the pads, goes for the flick but misses, off the pads to de Kock
length around off, comes forward and blocks
length outside off, gets behind it and defends it towards cover
a googly around off, pitching on a length and spinning away, Thisara pushes at it and gets beaten
tossed up and further away this time, googly again. Perera looks to smash it on the off side, miles away from the ball
length around off, comes forward and pushes it towards mid-off
length around off, comes forward to defend, an inside edge towards short fine leg, a bit of hesitation but all safe in the end
fuller on the stumps, drives it towards long-on
flighted on middle and leg, comes forward and flicks it towards long-on
short of length outside off, stays back and steers it towards backward point
back of length outside off, punched towards cover off the back foot
short of length around off, stays on the back foot and defends it square off the wicket on the off side
length around off, played with an angled bat towards third man
short of length outside off, gives himself some room and smashes it over point for four, just over the fielder's head
falls on his back in trying to get away from the this bouncer, was again trying to give himself some room but Rabada follows him
fuller on the stumps, flicked towards short midwicket
a googly from outside off, comes forward and defends
flighted outside off, comes forward and drives it through extra cover for four, all along the ground
tossed up at 79kph, fuller around off, inviting the batsman for another drive, he goes for out, gets a thick outside edge as the ball spins at him, away from first slip though
googly but down the leg side, needs to be bowled again
another googly, length ball on the stumps, stays back back and plays it towards square leg
length around off, defended from the crease
length outside off, fifth stump line, Dhananjaya pokes at it and gets beaten
a soft dismissal, chipped to short midwicket, it was fuller on the stumps, Dhananjaya plays a half shot, fails to keep it down and du Plessis accepts a dolly
fuller on the stumps, almost a yorker, Dananjaya stays leg side of the ball and gets his bat down to steer it towards covers
short of length around off, stays back and pushes at it, uppish but away from any fielder, a single to mid-off
short of length outside off, Dananjaya manages to stay away from it
short of length again, this time following the batsman who was looking to back away but the ball keeps angling in, manages to defend it on the off side though
fuller outside off, clears his front leg and smashes it through covers, past the diving short extra cover for four
length around off, spinning back in to Thisara, defended
length around off, spinning away, goes back and cuts it towards sweeper cover
quicker one around off, 96 kph, goes back to defend, ends up playing back on to his shoe
a full toss on the stumps, hits it towards midwicket for a couple
length around off, stays in the crease and defends
a bouncer at 141kph, following the batsman who ducks under
short of length outside off, goes back and cuts it towards sweeper cover
back of length around off, aimed at the batsman's throat who gets his bat in front and defends
back of length around off, defended from the back foot
length around off, looks to play towards cover, away from the body. Gets an inside edge on to his leg
short of length around off, gets on the back foot and defends it towards cover-point
fuller around off, drilled past the bowler but a brilliant sliding effort by Hendricks at long-off prevents the boundary
smashed over midwicket, a huge hit for a six, flighted around off, and Perera gives it his all
gone this time!. Flighted again but it's a googly this time. Perera looks to go over long-off but ends up slicing it towards deep extra cover where Miller settles under it. It's finishing soon
full and outside off, he drives to deep point

traps him lbw! Tahir's sprinted all the way to point. Didn't even bother to look at the umpire. His finger's up though. And this is special. This is Tahir's trademark. The quicker delivery. The googly. Pitching on off stump. Cutting back into the batsman - a batsman who thinks this will be a leg break and so he can go back and cut. 'Well, boo!' says the ball as it cuts in and strikes low on the back pad in front of the sticks
tossed up ball on middle, defends
fuller delivery on middle, he defends it
carves the pitched-up delivery on off stump at 142 kph to mid-off
goes for the ramp against a bouncer angled across him. Doesn't connect. De Kock collects it and immediately asks deep third man to come finer
clears the front leg against the slower ball - on a length outside off - and pulls to midwicket

taken by midwicket running to his right! It is quick. It is short. It cramps the left-hander and even though he tries to make room, he mistimes the shot, a pull that comes off with the bat still turning in his hands. That means he gets no power behind the ball and South Africa are all set to ride out into the sunset
back of a length on off stump, defends
googly - pitching on middle and turning in. The right hander tries to flick but only manages an inside edge
tossed up outside off, he goes for the big hit, long-off is lurking, but it falls short of him
full and turning into the right-hander again. He gets forward to block
huge swing over the leg side the moment he sees the ball tossed up, but the legbreak beats him handsomely. Good work from Miller behind the stumps though. Smart take, quick to break the stumps
pushes it through on off stump, Vishwa is able to keep it out
wraps up with a googly, which Vishwa taps into the covers

full and on off stump, Vishwa, as he did in Durban, somehow gets bat to it and moves off strike. Looks squared up. Doesn't fancy getting in line with the quick delivery. But yet there's the outside edge to the rescue

backs away and swats the short ball outside off straight to the substitute fielder Dale Steyn at cover point. Yep, Dale Steyn's a substitute fielder. And also, South Africa have won, despite putting up only 250 on the board
